name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Boston North

reviews.text: This is simply the perfect business hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable room, edible breakfast in the morning. The guy who gave me a lift to the airport, Joe, turned out to be the general manager and was a hella nice guy...very, very concerned that my stay had been a good one.
reviews.title: Zero problems...very friendly
Tired and Worn Hotel
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this hotel. It is long overdue for a freshening up.The hotel and room smelled, they tried to mask oit with some sort of air freshner.Basically the room was dingy. The bedding was awful with tiny pillows and the bathrooms grouting and tiles needed a good deep cleaning. The only positive was there was a flat screen TV and free Internet with a new desk.. This is not the quality I expect from a Marriott hotel. I would not stay here again.

We stayed here 1 night due to an early next morning flight. We used Marriott points for the rooms. If there are suites here I sure did not stay in one of them! Rooms were very small. We went down to the pool-small and disappointing as the whirlpool no longer there,but still listed on sign by pool. Not in the greatest of areas. It was clean. Cannot comment on breakfast as we left before it started. Do not think I would stay again.
reviews.title: average

reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect based on the mixed reviews here. I stayed here 4 nights & had no major problems to speak of. The area isn't too exciting but Dunkin Donuts/Shell gas station was next door if you needed something other than what the hotel offered. There was nothing else within walking distance. The hotel has a decent sized indoor pool & jacuzzi open until 11 pm & plenty of parking. The lobby/breakfast area was large & welcoming with plenty of tables & a tv. They have a small sundries shop/market with water, juice, soft drinks, frozen dinners & microwave, cookies, candy, nuts & other supplies. The front desk staff was always polite & helpful & even allowed me to use their computer when the business center was full. Breakfast was fine with waffle makers, plenty of muffins & pastries, cereal, juice, coffee, hot cocoa, tea, fruit, eggs & sausage daily. It is open at 6:30 am during the week & 7 am on weekends. The lady re-stocking the breakfast area wasn't too pleasant but it wasn't a big deal. The main elevator could be a bit slow but since I was only up one floor, I would either take the stairs or the elevator at the end of the hallway. I did a complete check of the bed, bedding, headboards, pillows, mattress & box springs upon arrival to look for any unwanted pests. I didn't find any, but I also didn't have zippered covers on the springs, mattress or pillows. With bed bugs such an issue these days, I can't believe hotels don't make this mandatory! I did have one pillow with a zippered cover but I think it was to prevent the feathers from poking through (it was partly made of down). My headboard had deep gashes carved in it & appeared as though someone had tried to touch them up with a stain pen but it was poorly done needed some wood filler to look better. I did find hair on a wash cloth & a dirty tub - it had hair in it & appeared as though someone had been standing in the tub with dirty shoes. I travel with my own cleaning/sanitation supplies so I just took care of it myself. I rarely check into a hotel these days without hair in the tub somewhere (it's so gross!) The spacious room had a large desk & refrigerator. The closet rod was in an awkward place as it didn't extend the length of the closet so it made it hard to get in & out of with the sliding doors. It was fine for me but if you had more than one person hanging clothes, it would be crowded. A cab to the airport was 24.00 & I didn't use the hotel's local shuttle service. A man working the front desk one evening was overwhelmed with people checking in, people trying to buy sundries & calls - he didn't seem to be able to multi-task. I stood there for over 10 minutes & finally told him I was leaving the money for the bottled water on the desk. I would stay here again, especially if I were traveling to Salem or points north of Boston. As this was for work, I didn't pay for the stay so I can't comment on the value.
reviews.title: Better than expected based on reviews

reviews.text: The hotel was ok good for an inn. So I could say that met my expectations. But if you are in Boston to travel and go around the area. I suggest find another hotel. The reason why the prices here is reasonably cheap is because. You will incur additional charges to go to Downtown. Their shuttle bus runs everyhour and does not run in between even though there are guests that needs to be sent to the train station. How bad is the customer service there. An example of a normal day to and from the hotel is this. From the hotel, they will send you to wonderland station. That is around 15min drive. Then from wonderland station it will take you 30-40 minutes to downtown. So all in all almost one hour spent to go to downtown. =(=(=(. Then going back you need to call them. An example of the when you call them from wonderland station. they will fetch you after 20 minutes then they will make rounds to the airport then to wonderland again. An example of a fetch takes me an hour from the station to the hotel.
reviews.title: Super Far from Boston Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a typical Fairfield Inn. Clean, updated, and an excellent value for the price. The Boston area is quite expensive. This was a good price for the area. A little out of downtown Boston, but at least $100 less expensive than anything downtown. Worth the drive.
reviews.title: Clean, Updated, Good Value

reviews.text: Stayed here prior to departing Boston so as to be near the airport. Prices are reasonable...for Boston. Hwy 1 in front of the hotel is weird in that must stop and pull out from fast moving traffic. To enter as you head south you must travel one mile past the hotel to the next exit as concrete barriers pervent left turns on Hwy 1. The hotel itself is pleasant. Our room was clean, quiet and spacious. There is a large, well stocked breakfast area. Trip back to the airport requires several different roads but the hotel offers clear, printed directions. All staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Quick stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was just "adequate". I traveled to Boston for a weekend getaway with my friend. Having stayed at many Fairfield Inn & Suites before, I figured I couldn't go wrong. In my opinion, the rooms in particular could use a face lift.
reviews.title: Adequate room

reviews.text: The location is pretty easy though, and the front desk clerk was kind enough to give us directions to some great places to eat.
reviews.title: They went out of their way for me

reviews.text: I needed a meeting room for 6 people in Revere. This Fairfield Inn gets heavy use as a "park & fly" for Logan airport. I was in a spot, no hotels had conference room availability on short notice. The manager of this hotel put me in a suite (517) and set up a table for our meeting. It was just about perfect. And I certainly appreciated the extra effort. Frankly this place is zoo like busy. It really should get a facility rating between very good and average. But the manager and front desk staff are so good, they get bumped for the focus on hospitality.
reviews.title: Not up to Normal Expectations

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and friendly. Room was clean, large bed, free wifi, flat screen tv with plenty of channels, clean large bathroom. Complimentary breakfast in the morning, plenty to eat so you won't feel hungry for awhile. Complimentary shuttle to the Wonderland Station, no airport shuttle. Nothing of note near the hotel so without a car sort of difficult to get around unless you depend on the shuttle which operates only during certain hours.
reviews.title: Nice for a night or two

reviews.text: Stayed here to be convenient to Salem and Boston. Decent breakfast but they constantly were running out of things and took a while to replace. Freezing cold pool, thin walls. Crazy that they don't have a safer way to enter property. Right on fast moving road with little or no notice that property is approaching. Love that they offered shuttle to Wonderland station. Very convenient.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: I stay here last wednsday and left today, good hotel, good rooms, excelent breakfast, nooo smoke. If i go again to Boston, here i will stay again.and the most important for me, thats very clean..my family and me, where very happy!!
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.text: The hotel seemed a little more run down than other properties of this caliber. The staff was friendly and helpful. The shuttle service to the subway station worked out well. The breakfast was average. The fitness room left a lot to be desired. There were two treadmills and an elliptical. The treadmill I was on felt a little unstable, the stop button cover was missing, and the attached T.V. would only stay on for a couple seconds at a time.
reviews.title: Okay, But Not Top Notch

reviews.text: Family friendly staff and amenities! Shuttle service was convenient and free. Breakfast was awesome! Sheets were soft as butter! Pillows were good quality down. Water was always hot. Quiet hours after 10 insured peaceful sleep. Great stay!
reviews.title: Excellent Service. Shuttle. Breakfast. Staff.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while in Boston for our son's orientation at Boston University. After reading some of the reviews I was concerned but I thought the hotel was great. We called when we arrived at the Wonderland T station and they sent the shuttle to get us. The room was big, clean and very nice. The continental breakfast had a lot of options and was open early in case you had to be somewhere early I thought the shuttle service was great. Granted it did only run certain times and you had to sign up for it but it still was a great service. You can easily reach the airport from the blue line so taking the shuttle to Wonderland is a less expensive way to get to the airport. All of our shuttle drivers were really nice and quite talkative and answered any questions we had about Boston.. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay near Boston.
reviews.title: college orientation

reviews.text: I won this property for $70 on priceline for a Sunday night stay (flew out of Logan the next day). I was driving US 1 South and the exit I took was basically a 90 degree angle exit vs the ones I normally see. Hotel itself was nice. Room has a king bed with a sleeper sofa. HDTV with minfrig in the room (no microwave but you can use one in the lobby). Other than a gas station, there is no walkable place to eat (but the hotel has a food pantry). Staff was nice and had a decent breakfast (eggs and sausage were available). You may want to leave early to Logan as the traffic can be a pain and you switch to State Hwy 60 to Logan which is just street traffic (ie, not a freeway).
reviews.title: Hotel good, location, not so much

reviews.text: Yes, this property is a little dated/worn and definitely not more than a 3 the Marriott scale simply because it is in need of a remodel. High traffic with a lot of overnight stays for travelers using it for the airport like we did. We slept great and the staff was pleasant! That makes a big difference.
reviews.title: A quick overnight

reviews.text: It is tricky to get to if you are traveling south on Route One. Don’t follow the mapping suggestions – simply take the next exit and get back on Route One going north and you can enter access hotel. We tried to find it using mapping and the back side streets which are not well marked. We were so close but ended up getting back on Rt. 1 to get there.
reviews.title: Marriott Quality

reviews.text: You don’t pay for parking and the airport isn’t too far away – our night was free so no complaints. If I was paying I probably would have stayed closer to have a more plush environment. (that’s me, not my husband) A little quirky that there wasn’t a microwave or small frig in room.
reviews.title: Low quality facility improved by its staff--only!!!!

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Boston North Hotel
description: Our hotel is located just 7 miles north of Boston on Route 1 North. We offer complimentary shuttle to/from Wonderland MBTA Station (Blue Line) during limited hours of the day. Please contact the hotel directly for hours and availability information. We hope you will consider our hotel for your stay as we offer a complimentary breakfast, an indoor pool , complimentary internet access and on property laundry services. The business center, located on our lobby level, is perfect for checking emails and printing boarding passes. Our team hopes to welcome you soon!
